gurmukhi: pMK hIn khwN aufY Ar nYn hIn inhwr ]SsqR hIn ju Dwn pYTb ArQ hIn ibcwr ]60]
transliteration: Pankh Heen Kahaan Udai Ar Nain Heen Nihaar|| Shastra Heenju Dhaan Paithab Arth Heen Bichaar||60||
translation: Hoe can one fly without the wings? And how can one see without the eyes? How can one go to the battlefield without weapons; and without understaning the meaning how can one understand any problem?.60.

gurmukhi: drb hIn bpwr jYsk ArQ ibn ies lok ]AwNK hIn iblokbo jig kwm kyl Akok ]
transliteration: Darah Heen Bapaar Jaisak Arth Bin Is Lok|| Aankh Bheen Bilok-bo Jag(i) Kaam Kel Alok||
translation: How can one indulge in trade without wealth? How can one visualise the lustful actions without eyes?

gurmukhi: igAwn hIn su pwT gIqw bu`D hIn ibcwr ]ih`mq hIn ju Dwn jUJb kyl hIn kumwr ]61]
transliteration: Giaan Heen Su Paath Geetaa Budddh Heen Bichaar|| Himmat Heen Ju Dhaan Joojhab Kel Heen Koumaar||61||
translation: How can one recite Gita without knowledge and reflect upon it without intellect? How can one go to the battlefield without counrage.61

gurmukhi: kaun kaun gnweIAY jy Bey BUp mhIp ]kaun kaun su k`QIAY jig ky sudÍIp AdÍIp ]
transliteration: Kaoun Kaoun Gadaaeeai Je Bhae Maheep|| Kau Kaoun Su Kattheeaijag(i) Ke Sudveep Adveep||
translation: How many kings were there? To want extent they be enumerated, and how far should the continents and regions of the world be described?

gurmukhi: jws kI n gnY vhY iem AOr kI nhI Skq ]Xo n AYs phcwnIAY ibn qws kIey Bgq ]62]
transliteration: Jaas Kina Gadai Vahai Im Aur Kinahishakat|| Yo Na Ais Pahchaaneeaibin Taas Keee Bhagad||62
translation: I have enumerated, only those which have come within my sight, I am unable to enumerate more and the this is also not possible without His devotion.62.

gurmukhi: sRySt sRySt Bey ijqy ieh BUm Awn nrys ]qaun qaun aucwr ho qumry pRswid Asys ]
transliteration: Sreshat Sreshat Bhae Jite Eh Bhnm Aan Dares|| Taoun Taoun Ouchaar Ho Toumre Prasaadh Ases||
translation: All the superb kings who had ruled over the earth, O Lord! With thy Grace, I describe at of them;

gurmukhi: BrQ rwj ibqIq By Bey rwj swgr rwj ]rudR kI qpsw krI lIA l`C suq auprwij ]63]
transliteration: Bharath Raaj Biteet Bhe Bhae Raaj Saagad Raaj|| Rudra Kitapsaa Karileea Lachchh Sout Oupraaj(i)||63||
translation: There was king sagar after Bharat, who meditated on Rudra and performed austerities; he obtained the boon of one lakh sons.63.

gurmukhi: ckR bkR Dujw gdw BRq srb rwj kumwr ]l`C rUp Dry mno jigAwn mYn su Dwr ]
transliteration: Chakra Bakra Dhujaa Gadaa Bhrat Sarab Raaj Koumaar|| Lachhh Roop Ddare Mano Jagiaan Main Su Dhaar||
translation: They were princes of discus, banners and maces and it seemed that the god of love had manifested himself in lakhs of forms;

gurmukhi: byK byK bny nryS su jIq dys Asys ]dws Bwv sBY Dry mn jqR qqR nrys ]64]
transliteration: Bekh Bekh Bade Daresh Su Jeet Ddes Ases|| Daas Bhaav Sabhai Ddare Man Jatra Tatra Dares||64||
translation: They conquered various countries and became kings considering them sovereigns became their servants.64.

gurmukhi: bwjmyD krY lgy hX swil qy hX cIn ]bol bol Amol ir`quj mMqR imqR pRbIn ]
transliteration: Baajmedh Darai Lage Haya Saal(i) Te Haya Cheen|| Bol Bola Mol Rittuj Mantra Mitra Prabeen||
translation: They selected a fine horse from their stable and decided to perform Ashvamedha Yajna; they invited the ministers, friends and Brahmins;

gurmukhi: sMg dIn smUh sYnw bXUh bXUh bnwie ]jqR qqR iPrY lgy isr AqR qqR iPrwie ]65]
transliteration: San Deen Samooh Sainaa Byooh Byooh Banaae|| Jatra Tatra Phirai Lage Sir Atra Tata Phiraae||65||
translation: After that they gave groups of their forces to their ministers, who moved here and there, swinging the canopies over their heada.65.

gurmukhi: joq pqR lhXo jhwN qh S`qR By sB cUr ]Coif Coif Bjy nrySn Cwf SsqR krUr ]
transliteration: Jot Patra Lahyo Jahaan Tah Shattra Bhe Sabh Chnr|| Chhodh(i) Chhodh(i) Bhaje Dareshan Chhaad Shastra Daroor||
translation: They obtained letter of victory from all the places and all their enemies were smashed; all the such kings ran away, forsaking their weapons;

gurmukhi: fwr fwr snwih sUr qRIXwn Bys suDwr ]Bwij Bwij cly jhw qh puqR imqR ibswr ]66]
transliteration: Daar Daar Sanaah(i) Soor Treeyaan Bhes Sudhaar|| Bhaaj(i) Bhaaj(i) Chale Jahaa Tah Poutra Mitra Bisaar||66||
translation: These warriors, putting off their armours, assuming the guise of women and forgetting their sons and friends, ran away here and there.66.

gurmukhi: gwij gwij gjy gdw Dir Bwij Bwij su BIr ]swj bwj qjy Bjy ibsMBwr bIr su DIr ]
transliteration: Gadj(i) Gadj(i) Gade Gadaa Dhar(i) Bhaaj(i) Bhaj(i) Su Bheer|| Saaj Baaj Taje Bhaje Bisanbhaar Beer Su Dheer||
translation: The mace-wielders thundered and the cowards fled away; many warriors leaving their paraphernalia ran away;
